name: wiki
title: LuckPerms Wiki
description: Learn how to use LuckPerms and all of its features by reading the wiki on GitHub.

name: install
title: Installing LuckPerms
description: You can install LuckPerms on Spigot/Paper, Sponge, BungeeCord/Waterfall, Velocity and others. Check the installation guide for more info on setting up LuckPerms.

name: bungee
title: Network Installation
description: If you run a Bungeecord network, learn how to correctly setup LuckPerms on all server instances (including Bungee).

name: sync
title: Syncing data between servers
description: To sync data between servers, you need to connect each LuckPerms plugin to the same database (for example MySQL) and set up a messaging service.

name: usage
title: Usage
description: Here's a guide to help users understand and use LuckPerms for the first time.

name: errors
title: Storage system errors
description: Here's a page with some common storage system errors.

name: editor
title: Web Editor
description: LuckPerms offers an easy to use, powerful Web Editor, with which you can add, delete and change permissions of groups and players.

name: verbose
title: Verbose
description: LuckPerms provides a `verbose` command to help you find out what permissions a command/plugin is checking.

name: meta
title: Prefixes, Suffixes & Meta
description: You can set prefixes, suffixes and other meta data in LuckPerms for players and groups. Note that LuckPerms does **not** manage chat. You need to use another plugin to show prefixes/suffixes in chat.

name: context
title: Context
description: You can set a permission or group on a per-world/per-server basis, through what we call "contexts".

name: default
title: Default Groups
description: LuckPerms provides a group that every player is added to upon joining the server, called `default`. You can use multiple methods to change the default group or change the name of it.

name: storage
title: Storage types
description: LuckPerms allows you to store data in a variety of storage types, read about the benefits and drawbacks of each type on the wiki.

name: weight
title: Weight
description: LuckPerms allows you to set weights in order to determine the priority of certain nodes, like permissions and even prefixes. A higher weight number is a higher priority.

name: commands
title: Command Usage
description: Find all of the available LuckPerms commands on the wiki.

name: faq
title: FAQ
description: Check out some of our frequently asked questions.

name: migration
title: Migration
description: Learn about the process of migrating from another permission plugin.

name: bulkupdate
title: Bulk Editing
description: Quickly update a large amount of user and group permissions by using the `bulkupdate` command.

name: switchstorage
title: Switching storage types
description: If you wish to change your storage type (e.g. to YAML or MySQL) you may need to follow these instructions to ensure your groups and permissions are migrated to the new storage type.

fields.key: Read more about the Storage types

name: stacking
title: Prefix & Suffix Stacking
description: Display multiple prefixes/suffixes alongside a player's name.

name: inheritance
title: Inheritance
description: Learn about inheritance.

name: tracks
title: Tracks
description: Tracks provide a method for you to promote/demote players along a track (or ladder) of groups.

name: advanced
title: Advanced Setup
description: Discover some of the more advanced concepts of LuckPerms, such as permission calculation, shorthand permissions and more.

name: argumentbased
title: Argument based command permissions
description: Fine tune exactly what users with permission to use LuckPerms can do.

name: api
title: Developer API
description: Learn how to use the LuckPerms API in your project.

name: placeholders
title: Placeholders
description: Display data such as user prefixes and groups from LuckPerms in other plugins.

name: permissions
title: Permissions
description: A list of permissions used by LuckPerms commands.

name: locale
title: Locale & Translations
description: Learn how to change all the message from LuckPerms.

name: config
title: LuckPerms Configuration
description: Learn what each of the config options are for.

name: extracontexts
title: Extra Contexts
description: Add contexts not supported by stock LuckPerms.

name: upgrade
title: Upgrading from v4 to v5
description: Read about upgrading LuckPerms from v4 to v5.

name: commandequivalents
title: Command Equivalents
description: Helpful page for people coming from other permission plugins.

name: extensions
title: Extensions
description: A list of all the Luckperms extensions.

name: selfhosting
title: Self Hosting
description: Learn how to self-host all the web interfaces.

name: whyluckperms
title: Why LuckPerms
description: Why should you choose LuckPerms? Read here to find out.

name: downloads
title: Downloads
description: You can download LuckPerms for Bukkit/Spigot, BungeeCord, Sponge, Nukkit and Velocity.

name: cauldron
title: Cauldron, Thermos, Forge + Bukkit Hacks
description: Installing LuckPerms on a Cauldron, Thermos and any other Forge + Bukkit server software may require additional steps.

name: essentials
title: Essentials
description: Make sure you are using EssentialsX and Vault for prefixes. For any other issues with Essentials, you should seek support in either <#308232296753004556> or the official EssentialsX support Discord.

name: colours
title: Colour Codes
description: A helpful list of all colour codes that you can use.

name: helpchat
title: Helpchat
description: Helpchat is a general plugin assistance discord as well as the home of DeluxeChat, PlaceholderAPI, and many more.

name: notworking
title: Please tell us what's going on!
description: We really would absolutely love to help you out! However, telling us that it isn't working wastes everyone's time. Please, just **describe the issue you're having clearly** and with as much detail as possible, and **send any relevant screenshots** of whatever problems you're having.

name: suggestions
title: Suggestions and Bug Reports
description: If you would like to request a feature for LuckPerms, or report a bug, feel free to open an issue on GitHub!

name: userinfo
title: Please take a screenshot!
description: Seeing a screenshot makes everything so much easier!

fields.key: For prefixes not showing up in chat:

fields.value: Server console: `/lp info` | Proxy console: `/lpb info`.

name: pasteit
title: Please use pastebin!
description: Seeing a paste of the problem makes everything so much easier! Use https://bytebin.lucko.me/ for easy pasting!

fields.value: Pastebin any relevant segments of the console log. If it's a startup error, this includes the entire startup log!
Pastebin the entire LuckPerms config file (passwords removed) as well as any other relevant files!

name: ask
title: Please ask your question!
description: Please ask the question you have. Don't ask to ask, or ask to DM someone. There are people here to help you, but we need to know what to help you with, so please just ask the question you want to in as much detail as possible!

fields.key: Why shouldn't I ask to ask?

name: chat
title: LuckPerms does not display things in chat!
description: LuckPerms is only able to send information to formatting plugins so that they display them properly. LuckPerms does not put the prefix in front of your name, you need a chat formatting plugin to do it, and you need Vault. Same goes for the tablist! If the information appears correctly when you run `/lp user <user> info`, LuckPerms is doing its job!

fields.key: What plugins can I use to format chat?

name: nowildcard
title: Wildcard issues
description: Some plugins are created in a way which results in odd behaviour when the root '*' wildcard is used.
